page.title: 09RUISLIP'S TRAFFIC PROBLEMS
page.content: The traffic problems in Ruislip are accute. On a survey done at the bottom of the High Street (the main shopping centre) going up Bury Street (B455) or Sharps Lane (a suburban road that was a short cut but has since been given restricted access), for five minutes on a wet Monday morning. 300 vehicles passed. 216 cars (72%), 75 vans (25%), 5 lorries (2%),1 bus (<1%), 1 taxi (<1%), and 2 hearses on the way to Breakspear Crematorium (within the Domesday block). A one way system was planned for the High Street but residents objected to the use of a suburban road for returning traffic. The car park in Ruislip is next to the leisure complex. The council charged a fee of 20p an hour after a period free of charge. The public didn't use the facility and now the price is 10p a day it is well used.
